meanings.definition: The degree to which a gene or set of genes is expressed in the phenotype of an individual.
meanings.sent1: The penetrance of the gene determined the traits shown in the offspring.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the penetrance of genes to understand inherited characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The penetrance of the gene made the family reunion quite interesting.
meanings.sent4: Hereditary traits showed up with the penetrance of a skilled detective.
meanings.sent5: The penetrance of the gene was as clear as a sunny day.

meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to pass through a barrier or membrane.
meanings.sent1: The penetrance of the chemical through the membrane was impressive.
meanings.sent2: Water's penetrance through the soil is crucial for plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The penetrance of the sauce through the pasta was surprisingly quick.
meanings.sent4: The penetrance of light through the window created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The penetrance of the scent filled the room with a delightful aroma.
